view

Class BattlePanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • view.BattlePanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.Observer, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class BattlePanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.util.Observer

    Class that represent the board of the Battleship game, and shows all the moves taken both by the Player and the Computer. A BattlePanel is a JPanel that holds two JButton grids, one of which is clickable by the user in order to simulate the action of the Player. Both grids are updated at every click, so that the actions taken by Computer can be seen as a color change in the grid cells it chooses to hit.

    If the BattleshipModel is "timed", this class also initializes a Timer held in CountdownPanel and adds the panel to this view.

    In this panel, the current instance of BattleshipModel can be saved in a binary file, if the user somehow wants to suspend the match and continue later on. This is the view that is accessed either after setting all Ships on the SetShipsPanel or if an existing valid binary file is found and "Load game" is clicked on StartLoadPanel.

    Author:
    20027017 & 20031485
    See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • BattlePanel

        public BattlePanel(BattleshipModel model,
                   BattleshipController controller)
        Constructor for the class BattlePanel. It links the BattleshipModel and the BattleshipController to private fields so that it can access their methods. Then it initializes its dimensions and its layout and, finally, links itself to the model as Observer to listen to changes in the BattleshipModel.
        Parameters:
        model - A BattleshipModel instance.
        controller - A BattleshipController Instance.

    • Method Detail

      • getTitle

        public static java.lang.String getTitle()
        Returns a String containing the title of the panel.
        Returns:
        A String containing the title of the panel.

      • setAllComponents

        public void setAllComponents()
        Utility method used to fill the BattlePanel with sub-panels and JButton grids. Launched when the panel is accessed.

      • setTimer

        public void setTimer(long secs)
        Sets a Timer held in CountdownPanel with an amount of seconds.
        Parameters:
        secs - The amount of seconds.

      • updateAllComponents

        public void updateAllComponents()
        Updates all the components set when BattlePanel is first accessed. Launched whenever a button is clicked or an action is taken.

      • setShipsGrid

        public void setShipsGrid()

        Sets all the components to create the ships grid, where the user can see its ships. It creates a JPanel with GridLayout and fills its cells with JButtons. All those JButtons are disabled and if the cell matches a Ship, it is colored in black; if it does not, it is colored in white.

        If the user is restoring a saved match, cells can also be blue if the Computer has hit that cell but there was no Ship underneath, or red if the corresponding Computer hit was successful.

      • updateShipsGrid

        public void updateShipsGrid()
        Whenever the Computer hits the Player, the JButton corresponding to the chosen coordinates becomes either red if those coordinates match the position of a Player's Ship, or blue otherwise. An unchosen cell remains white.

      • setHitsGrid

        public void setHitsGrid()

        Sets all the components to create the hits grid, where the user can see its fired hits. It creates a JPanel with GridLayout and fills its cells with JButtons. Its JButtons are disabled whenever they have already been clicked, and they are enabled and white-colored if they still are not. When the user clicks on a JButton from this grid, if the Computer had set a Ship in that position, on update the cell turns red, blue if the user missed.

        If the user is restoring a saved match, cells can also be blue if the Player had hit that cell but there was no Ship underneath, or red if the corresponding Player hit was successful.

      • updateHitsGrid

        public void updateHitsGrid()
        Whenever an enabled JButton from the ships grid is pressed, the grid is updated. That button turns disabled and changes its color: it becomes red if the button's coordinates match those of a Computer's Ship, blue otherwise.

      • setButtonsPanel

        public void setButtonsPanel()

        Creates and fills a JPanel with a JButton and two JLabels for win/loss conditions. When the JButton is pressed, the current instance of BattleshipModel is saved on a binary file.

        The two JLabels are initially invisible, but on win/loss condition the correct JLabel is shown.

      • getButtonFromHitsButtonGrid

        public javax.swing.JButton getButtonFromHitsButtonGrid(int i,
                                                       int j)
        Returns a JButton from the hits grid.
        Parameters:
        i - The row coordinate of the JButton's position.
        j - The column coordinate of the JButton's position.
        Returns:
        A JButton instance.

      • getSecsLeft

        public long getSecsLeft()
        Gets the remaining seconds to the end of the countdown.
        Returns:
        A long representing the remaining seconds to the end of the countdown.
